meanings.definition: A genetic element that can replicate independently of the host chromosome.
meanings.sent1: Episomes are small genetic structures that can copy themselves without needing the host's help.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study episomes to understand how genetic material can replicate on its own.
meanings.sent3: The episomes at the genetic party were the life of the chromosome!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas spread through the office like episomes, replicating and influencing everyone.
meanings.sent5: The concept of episomes is like a tiny, self-replicating puzzle piece in the genetic code.

meanings.definition: A plasmid that can integrate into the host genome.
meanings.sent1: Researchers use episomes to study how plasmids can become part of the host's genetic material.
meanings.sent2: Episomes play a crucial role in genetic engineering by integrating into the host genome.
meanings.sent3: The episomes in the cell's party were the plasmids that could dance into the genome!
meanings.sent4: Her influence on the team was like episomes integrating seamlessly into their work dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The integration of episomes into the host genome is like a genetic puzzle coming together.

meanings.definition: A DNA molecule that can exist separately from the chromosomal DNA.
meanings.sent1: Episomes are unique DNA molecules that can live independently from the main genetic material.
meanings.sent2: Studying episomes helps scientists understand how DNA can exist apart from the chromosomal DNA.
meanings.sent3: The episomes in the nucleus were the rebellious DNA molecules that wanted their own space!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like episomes breaking free from the constraints of traditional thinking.
meanings.sent5: The independence of episomes from chromosomal DNA is like a solo performer in a genetic orchestra.
